_source.contentraw:
New law allows non-citizens to vote in US

Incoming New York Mayor Eric Adams has allowed a bill giving the vote to non-citizens to become law automatically. That‚Äôs after the City Council passed it last month.

Non-citizen New Yorkers who have lived in the city for at least a month may legally vote in city elections as of next year, according to a bill which became law through the mayor‚Äôs inaction on Sunday. Adams, while expressing reservations with certain aspects of the bill, did not choose to veto or otherwise challenge it, allowing the City Council‚Äôs passage of the legislation to stand after what he called ‚Äúproductive dialogue‚Äù with others in city government.

https://www.rt.com/news/545510-nyc-allows-noncitizens-vote-adams/

_source.content: Edguy, Power Metal band from Germany. Been around a LONG time! Their debut album came out all the way back in '95! In 2001, singer/songwriter, & musical genius Tobias Sammet, started what turned out to be a very ambitious side-project called Avantasia. He released just a 5 song EP in 2001 under this name, & that was to be the end of it-at least that was what Sammet at the time wanted it to be! But, the fans wouldn't accept that, as the success of this mere 5 song EP catapulted into the stratosphere!üòÆ & the fans kept hammering Sammet about releasing a full length Avantasia album, till finally in '03, he conceded, & wrote what wound up being a massive 2 part concept album: "The Metal Opera" parts I & II. & said, k, I got that outta my system, now, leave me alone to just focus on Edguy! Well it only left the fans screaming for more!& FINALLY after another 4 more yrs., they got their wish, as Sammet sat down to write what turned into an epic, historic 3 part concept album, which started w/"The Scarecrow" in '08, followed up by part 2 of the same storyline in 2010, w/"The Angel Of Babylon", & part 3 being "The Wicked Symphony" in '11. & needless to say, Sammet STILL releases albums w/both Edguy & Avantasia. He typically does an album & tour w/Edguy, then one w/Avantasia. But, I think he is on hiatus, as Avantasia hasn't released a new album since 2019! The 1st 3 part concept albums mentioned above, were a modern retelling of "Faust". & the interesting & unique thing about Avantasia's albums is, they truly are stories, & he asks various singers from various bands to sing the diff parts of each character in the storyline. He's had singers from many underground bands, as well as legendary famous singers of very well known ones. From Khan (ex Kamelot), Sharon Den Adel (Within Temptation), Jon Oliva (ex Savatage) Tim "Ripper" Owens (ex Judas Priest, & Iced Earth), to Alice Cooper & Klaus Meine (Scorpions), & Eric Martin (MR. BIG), as well as Dee Snider (Twisted Sister), & Geoff Tate (ex Queensr√øche), & even guest musicians like Bruce Kulick & Eric Singer formerly of KI$$. I will post both Edguy & Avantasia vids later as well!

Edguy, Power Metal band from Germany. Been around a LONG time! Their debut album came out all the way back in '95! In 2001, singer/songwriter, & musical genius Tobias Sammet, started what turned out to be a very ambitious side-project called Avantasia. He released just a 5 song EP in 2001 under this name, & that was to be the end of it-at least that was what Sammet at the time wanted it to be! But, the fans wouldn't accept that, as the success of this mere 5 song EP catapulted into the stratosphere!üòÆ & the fans kept hammering Sammet about releasing a full length Avantasia album, till finally in '03, he conceded, & wrote what wound up being a massive 2 part concept album: "The Metal Opera" parts I & II. & said, k, I got that outta my system, now, leave me alone to just focus on Edguy! Well it only left the fans screaming for more!

& FINALLY after another 4 more yrs., they got their wish, as Sammet sat down to write what turned into an epic, historic 3 part concept album, which started w/"The Scarecrow" in '08, followed up by part 2 of the same storyline in 2010, w/"The Angel Of Babylon", & part 3 being "The Wicked Symphony" in '11. & needless to say, Sammet STILL releases albums w/both Edguy & Avantasia. He typically does an album & tour w/Edguy, then one w/Avantasia. But, I think he is on hiatus, as Avantasia hasn't released a new album since 2019!

The 1st 3 part concept albums mentioned above, were a modern retelling of "Faust". & the interesting & unique thing about Avantasia's albums is, they truly are stories, & he asks various singers from various bands to sing the diff parts of each character in the storyline. He's had singers from many underground bands, as well as legendary famous singers of very well known ones. From Khan (ex Kamelot), Sharon Den Adel (Within Temptation), Jon Oliva (ex Savatage) Tim "Ripper" Owens (ex Judas Priest, & Iced Earth), to Alice Cooper & Klaus Meine (Scorpions), & Eric Martin (MR. BIG), as well as Dee Snider (Twisted Sister), & Geoff Tate (ex Queensr√øche), & even guest musicians like Bruce Kulick & Eric Singer formerly of KI$$. card.description: City‚Äôs mayor, Eric Genrich, is asking a judge to punish former Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice Mike Gableman for what he says are ‚Äúfalse statements‚Äù in election integrity probe.
card.title: Green Bay mayor wants penalties, Republican lawmaker wants answers in election probe

_source.content: The city‚Äôs mayor, Eric Genrich, asked a Waukesha County judge to punish former Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice Mike Gableman for what he says are Gableman‚Äôs ‚Äúfalse statements.‚ÄùHe wants the judge to order Gableman to take-out a full-page ad in the state‚Äôs three largest newspapers ‚Äì the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, the Green Bay Press-Gazette and the Wisconsin State Journal ‚Äì and admit he was wrong.Gableman has said Genrich has repeatedly refused to cooperate with his investigation into Green Bay‚Äôs role with the so-called Zuckerbucks, and how outside activists ended up with so much access to Green Bay‚Äôs voting operation.State Rep. Janel Brandtjen, R-Menomonee Falls, who is running her own election investigation in the State Assembly, on Thursday said Genrich has a responsibility to tell voters the truth.Assembly Speaker Robin Vos, R-Rochester, has asked Gableman to wrap up his probe by the end of the month.Vos said he wants recommendations for legislation to shore up voting processes by February, and wants to see votes on those plans by the end of the spring session.https://justthenews.com/nation/states/green-bay-mayor-wants-penalties-republican-lawmaker-wants-answers-election-probe
_source.contentraw:
The city‚Äôs mayor, Eric Genrich, asked a Waukesha County judge to punish former Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice Mike Gableman for what he says are Gableman‚Äôs ‚Äúfalse statements.‚Äù

He wants the judge to order Gableman to take-out a full-page ad in the state‚Äôs three largest newspapers ‚Äì the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, the Green Bay Press-Gazette and the Wisconsin State Journal ‚Äì and admit he was wrong.

Gableman has said Genrich has repeatedly refused to cooperate with his investigation into Green Bay‚Äôs role with the so-called Zuckerbucks, and how outside activists ended up with so much access to Green Bay‚Äôs voting operation.

State Rep. Janel Brandtjen, R-Menomonee Falls, who is running her own election investigation in the State Assembly, on Thursday said Genrich has a responsibility to tell voters the truth.

Assembly Speaker Robin Vos, R-Rochester, has asked Gableman to wrap up his probe by the end of the month.

Vos said he wants recommendations for legislation to shore up voting processes by February, and wants to see votes on those plans by the end of the spring session.

* Investigation and detection of election fraud
* Election verification through polls, especially exit polling, statistical analysis and auditing
* Direct Action to demand the bare necessities of election integrity (Please sign the petition for Elections We Can All Believe In) https://electionintegrity.org/petition-americans-united-for-election-integrity-210104.cgi
* Democracy-building through organizing, communications and events

This group is associated with the non-profit organization, "Election Integrity," founded in 2004. We have a Google group since 2006 and Facebook groups since early 2011. This Gab group was established to move these efforts to a platform *free from censorship*. But you can visit those groups for archives from our history.

Members are encouraged to post their own E.I.-related videos, photos, actions, testimonials and documents to our group page. Please keep the posts directly relevant to Election Integrity issues, and please be respectful of other group members. We are an open group, and must remain an open group if we are to continue to grow and get the word out about systematic election fraud in America.

card.description: A Manhattan congressman and his rabbi played a crucial role in President Clinton‚Äôs controversial pardon of former Weather Underground member Susan Rosenberg, aides said yesterday. Rabbi J. Ro‚Ä¶
card.title: NADLER BEHIND LETHAL-HEIST PARDON

_source.content:
@AuntSueNomie Rabbi J. Rolando Matalon of Temple B‚Äônai Jeshurun showed Democratic Rep. Jerrold Nadler ‚Äúcompelling information from [Rosenberg‚Äôs] parole hearing‚Äù and ‚Äúpassed on the concerns of her family,‚Äù said Nadler spokesman Eric Schmeltzer.

That intercession played a key role in Clinton‚Äôs decision Friday to commute the 58-year weapons-possession sentence for Rosenberg, long a suspect in the deadly 1981 Brink‚Äôs robbery in Nyack. She was never convicted on that charge.

‚ÄúWhat [Nadler] did was to pass on the materials to the White House counsel‚Äôs office and say, ‚ÄòI‚Äôd like you to take a look at this,'‚Äù Schmeltzer said.

Neither the rabbi nor Nadler, who was well-regarded at the Clinton White House because he was one of the president‚Äôs most ardent defenders during Sexgate, could be reached for comment yesterday.

card.description: A watershed moment for the most populous US city as opponents vow to challenge the law
card.title: New York will allow non-citizens to vote under controversial law

_source.content:
https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2022/jan/09/new-york-allows-non-citizens-vote-controversial-law

Same shit, different day....

More than 800,000 non-citizens and ‚ÄúDreamers‚Äù could vote in New York City municipal elections as early as next year, after Mayor Eric Adams allowed legislation to become law on Sunday.

Advertisement
Why some of your favorite podcasts are filled with oil company ads
Opponents have vowed to challenge the law, which the city council approved a month ago. Unless a judge halts its implementation, New York is the first major US city to grant widespread municipal voting rights to non-citizens.

More than a dozen communities across the US allow non-citizens to vote in local elections, including 11 towns in Maryland and two in Vermont. Non-citizens cannot vote for president or Congress, or in state elections.

The New York board of elections must begin an implementation plan by July, including registration rules and provisions to create separate ballots for municipal races.

card.title: NYC Mayor Defends Picking Brother for NYPD Job...Because of 'White Supremacy' Threat

_source.content: NYC Mayor Defends Picking Brother for NYPD Job...Because of 'White Supremacy' Threat1/10/2022 0700 hrs et | Leah Barkoukishttps://townhall.com/tipsheet/leahbarkoukis/2022/01/10/nyc-mayor-defends-choosing-brother-as-nypd-commissioner-n2601626New York City Mayor Eric Adams on Sunday defended his decision to name his brother, former NYPD police officer Bernard Adams, as a deputy NYPD commissioner.Though he acknowledged a city ethics panel will ‚Äúmake the determination‚Äù on whether there‚Äôs a conflict of interest over bringing on his brother for the job, Adams argued it‚Äôs necessary given the threat he faces from ‚Äúwhite supremacy.‚Äù‚ÄúLet me be clear on this: My brother is qualified for the position. Number one, he will be in charge of my security, which is extremely important to me at a time when we see an increase in white supremacy and hate crimes,‚Äù he told CNN‚Äôs Jake Tapper on ‚ÄúState of the Union.‚Äù‚ÄúI have to take my security in a very serious way,‚Äù the mayor added.During a press conference on Sunday, Adams went into more detail about why he chose his brother.‚ÄúProtection is personal. You have an increase of anarchists in this city, country. We have a serious problem with white supremacy. And when you talk about this type of security that I want, it‚Äôs extremely unique. I don‚Äôt want to be away from my public,‚Äù he said.
_source.contentraw:
NYC Mayor Defends Picking Brother for NYPD Job...Because of 'White Supremacy' Threat
1/10/2022 0700 hrs et | Leah Barkoukis
https://townhall.com/tipsheet/leahbarkoukis/2022/01/10/nyc-mayor-defends-choosing-brother-as-nypd-commissioner-n2601626

New York City Mayor Eric Adams on Sunday defended his decision to name his brother, former NYPD police officer Bernard Adams, as a deputy NYPD commissioner.

Though he acknowledged a city ethics panel will ‚Äúmake the determination‚Äù on whether there‚Äôs a conflict of interest over bringing on his brother for the job, Adams argued it‚Äôs necessary given the threat he faces from ‚Äúwhite supremacy.‚Äù

‚ÄúLet me be clear on this: My brother is qualified for the position. Number one, he will be in charge of my security, which is extremely important to me at a time when we see an increase in white supremacy and hate crimes,‚Äù he told CNN‚Äôs Jake Tapper on ‚ÄúState of the Union.‚Äù
‚ÄúI have to take my security in a very serious way,‚Äù the mayor added.

During a press conference on Sunday, Adams went into more detail about why he chose his brother.

‚ÄúProtection is personal. You have an increase of anarchists in this city, country. We have a serious problem with white supremacy. And when you talk about this type of security that I want, it‚Äôs extremely unique. I don‚Äôt want to be away from my public,‚Äù he said.

card.description: The New York City mayor Eric Adams allowed a bill to become law Sunday, making about 800,000 noncitizens in the city eligible to vote in municipal elections.
card.title: 800,000 Noncitizens Allowed to Vote in NYC Elections

_source.content:
New York City Mayor Eric Adams allowed a measure to become law on Jan. 9 making about 800,000 noncitizens in the city eligible to vote in municipal elections.

‚ÄúI believe that New Yorkers should have a say in their government, which is why I have and will continue to support this important legislation,‚Äù Adams said in a statement. ‚ÄúI believe allowing the legislation to be enacted is by far the best choice, and look forward to bringing millions more into the democratic process.‚Äù

The bill was approved by the City Council on Dec. 9, 2021, giving the mayor 30 days to veto; Adams allowed it to become law without any action. Former Mayor Bill de Blasio had expressed concerns about the measure but declined to veto it before leaving office on Dec. 31.

_source.content:
This is a horrific, painful moment for New York': Eric Adams visits scene of Bronx apartment fire that killed 19 people - including nine children - in first major crisis since becoming mayor.

New York City Mayor Eric Adams visited the scene of a 'horrific' Bronx apartment blaze that killed at least 19 people Sunday as he endured his first major crisis during his first nine days as the city's top politician.

The deadly fire - believed the worst to hit the city in more than 30 years - injured more than five dozen others, including 13 who were hospitalized in critical condition. It is believed to have been caused by a space heater being used to warm an apartment, with the 19 dead comprising nine children and 10 adults.

Appearing solemn as he spoke to reporters outside the charred building, Adams called the tragedy a 'horrific, painful moment' for the city.


'This is going to be one of the worst fires that we have witnessed during modern times,' he said.

During a press conference, Adams confirmed that the building appeared to be in violation of a law whereby fire doors should automatically close, as heat and smoke were able to pour through the tower's other floors, killing many of those living above the blaze.

He said an investigation will now be launched, and also told of how firefighters had bravely gone into the building despite having no oxygen left in their tanks.

The historic blaze is the latest challenge Adams is tasked with navigating after being inaugurated January 1 as the city's 110th mayor.

During the past week, he's been chastised by Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez over a 'low-skill workers' reference, berated by others for hiring his brother as the NYPD's deputy commissioner, and separately forced to 911 after witnessing am assault.

He has also been dragged into a quarrel about newly-elected Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg, who last Monday instructed his office to downgrade burglary, carrying a weapon and drug dealing from felony charges.

Adams' focus Sunday was on leading the city through the aftermath of the deadly blaze at the Twin Park apartments, a 19-story building on East 181st Street.

News photographers at the scene captured images of firefighters entering the upper floors of the burning building on a ladder, multiple limp children being given oxygen after being carried from the building and evacuees with their faces covered in soot.

FDNY Commissioner Daniel Nigro compared the severity of the fire to the Happy Land social club fire, which killed 87 people in 1990 when man set fire to the building after getting into an argument with his former girlfriend and being thrown out of the club.

card.title: New law allows non-citizens to vote in US

_source.content:
'New Law Allows Non-Citizens To Vote In U.S.A...... Unless a judge blocks the bill, New York will be the first US city to enfranchise non-citizens

'Law'less

Incoming New York Mayor Eric Adams has allowed a bill giving the vote to non-citizens to become law automatically. That‚Äôs after the City Council passed it last month.

Non-citizen New Yorkers who have lived in the city for at least a month may legally vote in city elections as of next year, according to a bill which became law through the mayor‚Äôs inaction on Sunday. Adams, while expressing reservations with certain aspects of the bill, did not choose to veto or otherwise challenge it, allowing the City Council‚Äôs passage of the legislation to stand after what he called ‚Äúproductive dialogue‚Äù with others in city government.

NYPD commissioner appointed in front of mural praising convicted ‚Äòdomestic terrorist‚Äô
Read more NYPD commissioner appointed in front of mural praising convicted ‚Äòdomestic terrorist‚Äô

While there are more than a dozen communities in the US that allow non-citizens to vote, New York ‚Äì with more than 800,000 non-citizens calling the city (at least a temporary) home ‚Äì is by far the most populous to pass such a measure. Eleven towns in Maryland and two in Vermont have done the same, but their populations amount to only a fraction of the country‚Äôs largest urban area.

Legally-documented voting-age non-citizens reportedly make up one in nine of New York‚Äôs 7 million adult residents. If the new law goes unchallenged, non-citizens who have been lawful permanent residents of New York for at least 30 days, as well as those with US work authorization and ‚ÄòDreamers‚Äô, will be allowed to vote in elections for the city‚Äôs mayor, borough presidents, comptroller, public advocate, and city council members. card.title: New law allows non-citizens to vote in US

_source.content:
https://www.rt.com/news/545510-nyc-allows-noncitizens-vote-adams/

New law allows non-citizens to vote in US

Most of the non-citizens will be nonwhite. It'll be disastrous when they start voting special benefits for themselves. NYC politicians now have yet another special interest group to pander to.

"Incoming New York Mayor Eric Adams has allowed a bill giving the vote to non-citizens to become law automatically. That‚Äôs after the City Council passed it last month.

Non-citizen New Yorkers who have lived in the city for at least a month may legally vote in city elections as of next year, according to a bill which became law through the mayor‚Äôs inaction on Sunday. Adams, while expressing reservations with certain aspects of the bill, did not choose to veto or otherwise challenge it, allowing the City Council‚Äôs passage of the legislation to stand after what he called ‚Äúproductive dialogue‚Äù with others in city government.

While there are more than a dozen communities in the US that allow non-citizens to vote, New York ‚Äì with more than 800,000 non-citizens calling the city (at least a temporary) home ‚Äì is by far the most populous to pass such a measure. Eleven towns in Maryland and two in Vermont have done the same, but their populations amount to only a fraction of the country‚Äôs largest urban area.

Legally-documented voting-age non-citizens reportedly make up one in nine of New York‚Äôs 7 million adult residents. If the new law goes unchallenged, non-citizens who have been lawful permanent residents of New York for at least 30 days, as well as those with US work authorization and ‚ÄòDreamers‚Äô, will be allowed to vote in elections for the city‚Äôs mayor, borough presidents, comptroller, public advocate, and city council members. They will not be allowed to vote in national or state elections.

_source.content: WASHINGTON: COURT TO HEAR MOTIONS TO DISMISS JAN6 LAWSUITS AGAINST DONALD TRUMP, RUDY GIULIANI AND OTHER JAN6 ALLEGED PLOTTERSCALIFORNIA CONGRESSMAN ERIC STALLWELL and others seek to sue #DonaldTrump and others for their alleged roles in the January 6 #CapitolRiots. #Stallwell, a California democrat joins ten other house members and two Capitol police officers in a suit to obtain damages for the alleged attempt and /or alleged conspiracy by Trump, Rep. #MoBrooks (R. Ala), Trump advisors #Rudy Giuliani and #DonaldTrumpJr., and two political groups to stop the certification of the #electoralcollege on January 6.  Stallwell and other congressional plaintiffs say they were placed in fear of bodily harm, and were unable to carry out their duties from the rioting.  The two #capitolpoliceofficers seek damages for being pelted with signs, water bottles, objects and unspecified ‚Äúchemical sprays.‚Äù  The plaintiffs arguing in court against the court dismissing the action before pre trial discovery starts. Trump and his co-defendants seek dismissal claiming they are not responsible for the rioters‚Äô acts. Trump also exerts #immunity as then-President, while Congressman Brooks raises a similar immunity defense.  Both assert that if the suit goes forward, it would have a chilling effect on free-political speech, and would serve to weaponize civil actions to damage the reputations of politicians. Meanwhile, regarding Rep. Brooks, Attorney General #MerrickGarland has taken the position that Brooks‚Äô actions ‚Äîallegedly spurring on a riot‚Äîfall outside his official duties as a lawmaker, and he is thus outside the protections afforded his office. The civil lawsuits being heard presently are one of three avenues being pursued in response to the riots. The first proceeding was an #impeachmentproceeding aimed at barring Trump from ever again holding the office of President, after he had left the White House, in February of 2021. That proceeding failed as Trump  was acquitted.  However, some of Trump‚Äôs harshest critics, drawn from both parties, sit on the #HouseSelectCommittee investigating the Capitol riots, said to be the second proceeding. The #Jan6committee is now gathering evidence and is locked in #constitutional court battles with Trump, his staffers and other lawmakers over attempting to  utilize #subpoenas against other members of Congress ‚Äîan alleged violation of speech or debate clause‚Äîand to override a former president‚Äôs alleged #executive privilege. The committee‚Äôs initial findings are due by summer of 2022. The civil lawsuits being argued January 10 are the third wave of responses to the riots. Trump, Giuliani, Brooks and Donald Trump Jr. have not been criminally charged, but members of the two named political-group-defendants‚Äîthe Oath Keepers  and the Proud Boys‚Äîhave been charged criminally.  They pled not guilty.   FOLLOW US FOR BREAKING NEWS AND DAILY PODCASTS, TAP THE PIPELINE/HIRSCHHORNMEDIA ICON AND PRESS FOLLOW.

WASHINGTON: COURT TO HEAR MOTIONS TO DISMISS JAN6 LAWSUITS AGAINST DONALD TRUMP, RUDY GIULIANI AND OTHER JAN6 ALLEGED PLOTTERS

CALIFORNIA CONGRESSMAN ERIC STALLWELL and others seek to sue #DonaldTrump and others for their alleged roles in the January 6 #CapitolRiots. #Stallwell, a California democrat joins ten other house members and two Capitol police officers in a suit to obtain damages for the alleged attempt and /or alleged conspiracy by Trump, Rep. #MoBrooks (R. Ala), Trump advisors #Rudy Giuliani and #DonaldTrumpJr., and two political groups
to stop the certification of the #electoralcollege on January 6.

Stallwell and other congressional plaintiffs say they were placed in fear of bodily harm, and were unable to carry out their duties from the rioting. The two #capitolpoliceofficers seek damages for being pelted with signs, water bottles, objects and unspecified ‚Äúchemical sprays.‚Äù The plaintiffs arguing in court against the court dismissing the action before pre trial discovery starts.

Trump and his co-defendants seek dismissal claiming they are not responsible for the rioters‚Äô acts. Trump also exerts #immunity as then-President, while Congressman Brooks raises a similar immunity defense. Both assert that if the suit goes forward, it would have a chilling effect on free-political speech, and would serve to weaponize civil actions to damage the reputations of politicians.

Meanwhile, regarding Rep. Brooks, Attorney General #MerrickGarland has taken the position that Brooks‚Äô actions ‚Äîallegedly spurring on a riot‚Äîfall outside his official duties as a lawmaker, and he is thus outside the protections afforded his office.

The civil lawsuits being heard presently are one of three avenues being pursued in response to the riots. The first proceeding was an #impeachmentproceeding aimed at barring Trump from ever again holding the office of President, after he had left the White House, in February of 2021. That proceeding failed as Trump was acquitted. However, some of Trump‚Äôs harshest critics, drawn from both parties, sit on the #HouseSelectCommittee investigating the Capitol riots, said to be the second proceeding.

The #Jan6committee is now gathering evidence and is locked in #constitutional court battles with Trump, his staffers and other lawmakers over attempting to utilize #subpoenas against other members of Congress ‚Äîan alleged violation of speech or debate clause‚Äîand to override a former president‚Äôs alleged #executive privilege. The committee‚Äôs initial findings are due by summer of 2022.

The civil lawsuits being argued January 10 are the third wave of responses to the riots. Trump, Giuliani, Brooks and Donald Trump Jr. have not been criminally charged, but members of the two named political-group-defendants‚Äîthe Oath Keepers and the Proud Boys‚Äîhave been charged criminally. They pled not guilty.

_source.content:
Chicago mom is charged with murder after her missing son, 6, was found dead - and his older siblings have been charged with beating him and helping cover up the crime.


A mother and two of her children have been charged in the death of her six year-old son after they spun a 'completely false' story that he was missing after he was killed.

Damari Perry, 6, was reported missing on January 5 by his mother Jannie Perry, 38, and his 20-year-old brother, Jeremiah R. Perry,

They reportedly told authorities that he may have gone missing in Skokie, Illinois, where he and his 16-year-old sister were driven to a party, according to NBC 5 Chicago.


When police questioned the girl, she reportedly told officers that she fell asleep after having several drinks and woke up to find that Damari and the man who had driven them were gone.

But investigators quickly uncovered several contradictions in the story based on evidence they found in Skokie, and instead turned their attention to the boy's North Chicago home.

They interviewed several juvenile witnesses at the Lake County Children's Advocacy Center, who led them to find Damari's body near an abandoned home in Gary, Indiana.

His cause of death has not yet been revealed, and an autopsy is scheduled for Monday.

But on Friday, Damari's mother and two of his siblings were brought into custody.

According to authorities, Damari was punished by being placed in a cold shower for an undetermined amount of time prior to his death.

He reportedly 'did something to upset family' on December 29, NBC 5 Chicago reports, and as a result, family members put him in the cold shower.

At some point, Damari vomited and was then taken out of the shower, but he eventually died. Prosecutors claim the relatives did not call for medical help and instead spun the 'completely false' story about Skokie.

Damari's mother, Jannie, is now charged with first-degree murder, concealment of a homicidal death and obstructing justice.

Jeremiah was also charged with aggravated battery causing great bodily harm to a child under 12, concealing a homicidal death and obstructing justice. A judge on Sunday ordered him held on a $3 million bail.

And an unnamed juvenile sibling also faces charges in Lake County Juvenile Court, with no further details offered on that suspect.

More charges could be filed against the family as the investigation continues.

'Our hearts ache over the murder of 6-year-old Damari Perry,' Lake County State's Attorney Eric Rinehart said in a statement. 'We would not have reached the awful truth of this case without the work of the FBI, the North Chicago Police Department and the investigators and staff at the Lake County Children's Advocacy Center.'

His 20-year-old brother, Jeremiah R. Perry, (pictured) was charged with aggravated battery causing great bodily harm to a child under 12, concealing a homicidal death and obstructing justice. He is being held on a $3 million bond.
